Class TreeMapOptions

  • public class TreeMapOptions
extends Options
    Configuration options for TreeMap.
    See Also:
    Tree map Configuration Options

      • setForceIFrame

        public final void setForceIFrame(boolean forceIFrame)
        Draws the chart inside an inline frame. (Note that on IE8, this option is ignored; all IE8 charts are drawn in i-frames.)
        Parameters:
        forceIFrame - true for drawing inside an inline frame

      • setHeaderColor

        public final void setHeaderColor(String headerColor)
        Sets the color of the header section for each node. Specify an HTML color value.
        Parameters:
        headerColor - default is #988f86

      • setHeaderHeight

        public final void setHeaderHeight(int headerHeight)
        Sets the height of the header section for each node, in pixels (can be zero).
        Parameters:
        headerHeight -

      • setHeaderHighlightColor

        public final void setHeaderHighlightColor(String headerHighlightColor)
        Sets the color of the header of a node being hovered over. Specify an HTML color value or null; if null this value will be headerColor lightened by 35%.
        Parameters:
        headerHighlightColor -

      • setHintOpacity

        public final void setHintOpacity(double hintOpacity)
        When maxPostDepth is greater than 1, causing nodes below the current depth to be shown, hintOpacity specifies how transparent it should be. It should be between 0 and 1; the higher the value, the fainter the node.
        Parameters:
        hintOpacity - a value from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque)

      • setMaxColor

        public final void setMaxColor(String maxColor)
        Sets The color for a rectangle with a column 3 value of maxColorValue. Specify an HTML color value.
        Parameters:
        maxColor - default is #00dd00

      • setMaxColorValue

        public final void setMaxColorValue(double maxColorValue)
        Sets the maximum value allowed in column 3. All values greater than this will be trimmed to this value. If set to null, it will be set to the max value in the column.
        Parameters:
        maxColorValue -

      • setMaxDepth

        public final void setMaxDepth(int maxDepth)
        Sets the maximum number of node levels to show in the current view. Levels will be flattened into the current plane. If your tree has more levels than this, you will have to go up or down to see them. You can additionally see maxPostDepth levels below this as shaded rectangles within these nodes.
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - default is 1

      • setMaxHighlightColor

        public final void setMaxHighlightColor(String maxHighlightColor)
        Sets the highlight color to use for the node with the largest value in column 3. Specify an HTML color value or null; If null, this value will be the value of maxColor lightened by 35%
        Parameters:
        maxHighlightColor -

      • setMaxPostDepth

        public final void setMaxPostDepth(String maxPostDepth)
        Sets how many levels of nodes beyond maxDepth to show in "hinted" fashion. Hinted nodes are shown as shaded rectangles within a node that is within the maxDepth limit.
        Parameters:
        maxPostDepth -

      • setMidColor

        public final void setMidColor(String midColor)
        Sets the color for a rectangle with a column 3 value midway between maxColorValue and minColorValue. Specify an HTML color value.
        Parameters:
        midColor -

      • setMidHighlightColor

        public final void setMidHighlightColor(String midHighlightColor)
        Sets the highlight color to use for the node with a column 3 value near the median of minColorValue and maxColorValue. Specify an HTML color value or null; if null, this value will be the value of midColor lightened by 35%.
        Parameters:
        midHighlightColor -

      • setMinColor

        public final void setMinColor(String minColor)
        Sets the color for a rectangle with the column 3 value of minColorValue. Specify an HTML color value.
        Parameters:
        minColor -

      • setMinColorValue

        public final void setMinColorValue(double minColorValue)
        Sets the minimum value allowed in column 3. All values less than this will be trimmed to this value. If set to null, it will be calculated as the minimum value in the column.
        Parameters:
        minColorValue -

      • setMinHighlightColor

        public final void setMinHighlightColor(String minHighlightColor)
        Sets the highlight color to use for the node with a column 3 value nearest to minColorValue. Specify an HTML color value or null; if null, this value will be the value of minColor lightened by 35%
        Parameters:
        minHighlightColor -

      • setNoColor

        public final void setNoColor(String noColor)
        Sets the color to use for a rectangle when a node has no value for column 3, and that node is a leaf (or contains only leaves). Specify an HTML color value.
        Parameters:
        noColor -

      • setNoHighlightColor

        public final void setNoHighlightColor(String noHighlightColor)
        Sets the color to use for a rectangle of "no" color when highlighted. Specify an HTML color value or null; if null, this will be the value of noColor lightened by 35%.
        Parameters:
        noHighlightColor -

      • setShowScale

        public final void setShowScale(boolean showScale)
        Whether or not to show a color gradient scale from minColor to maxColor along the top of the chart. Specify true to show the scale.
        Parameters:
        showScale -
